TopicTitle: How do I install mods on the steam version?

Articles.Content: I bought the steam version and can't figure out how to install mods please help... man i really hope you can install mods at all.

Installing mods is easy so long as they are for the latest version, just extract the files and put them into the Gamedata directory. They are find to leave in the folder they come in, and it makes it easier to manage.

The Steam client should have a "browse local files" option in the properties window for KSP. Right-click on KSP in your library, and select properties from the menu. That should open a window on the main KSP install directory (buried a few levels deep inside Steam's data directory by default). You'll know if you're in the right place by the presence of the GameData directory. That's just to help you find the location. Once you know where it is, you can go direct to it, no need to go via the Steam client app.

While you're there, take the opportunity to backup your saves, craft files, etc.

To be real safe, copy the entire game to a different location, install your mods to it, and run that version of the game from its own icon. Then, if something goes wrong, you always have the original game as a backup. In addition, it will be a lot easier to install mods and recover screenshots from a path such as D:Games\ KSP\Screenshots then to go through the long tree from the C folder that Windows with Steam forces you through.

Best bet is to make a shortcut on your desktop for the steam 'common' folder. All your games will be in there. Mods go in GameData as usual.

If you make a copy of the game, (Which is a great idea by the way, I have one for testing out new mods and stability before putting them into my main game), steam screenshots won't work, you have been warned!

Maybe the problem is on a Mac?

You need to find the files... In the Finder, press "ALT" while clicking on "Go", go to "library". Then, install as usual.

I.e.: Move the mods into the Game Data folder.

The instructions I gave above for finding it via the Steam client work on a Mac, as that's the platform I tested it on.

For reference, the default location on a Mac for the Steam install of KSP is:

/Users/<your_username>/Library/Application Support/Steam/SteamApps/common/Kerbal Space Program

I've tried all of this with the environmental enhancements and distant object enhancement mods and it hasn't seemed to work. I took the folders, extracted them, put them in GameData and launched the game. The mods didn't seem to work. I tried again, this time putting them into the squad folder, and still, nothing. Figuring out how to do this is key considering I want to get Kerbal Engineer Redux and a few other mods.
